creator: everman@precedadesign.com
text:
Creating a default welcome page works differently in the default context (path
"") then any other context (path = "somepath").

For instance, a welcome file list defined as this:

<welcome-file-list>
  <welcome-file>/welcome/welcome.jsp</welcome-file>
</welcome-file-list>

Will work for a context defined as:

<Context path="/aPath" docBase="base1" />

But will redirect the client incorrectly for this context:

<Context path="" docBase="base2" />

As a work-arround, the welcome file list can be defined without the first "/"
like this:

<welcome-file-list>
  <welcome-file>welcome/welcome.jsp</welcome-file>
</welcome-file-list>

This is perhaps not so much a bug as an unclear spec - the welcome file entry is
used to redirect the client, but the serlet spec and the Tomcat docs don't
mention how the redirect is put together.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
The URLs defined in the welcome file list should be relative to the current
directory ("/foo" is at best relative to the context root, and welcome files
don't work like that).
See section 9.10 of the servlet spec.
